fi.grimripper.loww.movement

Class DefaultMovement

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.grimripper.loww.movement.MovementMode
      • fi.grimripper.loww.movement.DefaultMovement

  • public class DefaultMovement
extends MovementMode
    This is the default movement implementation, which progresses outward from a starting position. It uses the default movement costs for terrain and obstacles. A mobile object can move from a tile to any of its neighbors, as long as movement cost, movement events or blocks don't prevent it.
    Author:
    Marko Tuominen

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

    • Method Detail

      • movementRadius

        public void movementRadius(int totalMove)
        Determines movement radius, starting at the host's current location. The current location gets total move cost zero, and is set occupiable. The facing directions available in it are also set. Uses PathData objects to save path data. First clears old movement radius, then sets the starting tile's occupy height, creates a path data object for it using occupy height, and calls the beginSearch method to generate successors for the starting location. After that, removes path data objects for successors from a search list and calls addProgressTiles for each to generate new successors. Successors with a risk are stored separately, and iterated in the same way once there are no more safe paths to explore.
        Specified by:
        movementRadius in class MovementMode
        Parameters:
        totalMove - the mobile object's total movement
        See Also:
        DefaultMovement.PathData, beginSearch(PathData, int), addProgressTiles(PathData)

      • getMovementPath

        public Tile[] getMovementPath(Tile pathTo,
                     Direction facing)
        Generates path from saved path data. Can be used during movement radius generation, but only for tiles which have already been processed. Also, the path which is given during movement radius generation isn't necessarily the shortest since all paths haven't been explored yet.
        Specified by:
        getMovementPath in class MovementMode
        Parameters:
        pathTo - find movement path to this tile
        facing - facing in the destination tile
        Returns:
        the path to the given tile

      • executeMovementPath

        public Tile[] executeMovementPath(Tile destination,
                         Direction facing)
        Makes mobile object move along a path to a destination, executing movement events. The starting tile's enter tile events and the destination tile's leave tile events aren't executed. If movement events prevent the mobile object from moving to its destination, finds a place for the mobile object to occupy. This can be any tile along the movement path up to and including the last tile the mobile object entered, as well as the starting tile.
        Specified by:
        executeMovementPath in class MovementMode
        Parameters:
        destination - the destination tile
        facing - the host's facing in the destination tile
        Returns:
        the path of tiles the mobile object moved through (includes the destination tile, but not the starting tile); empty array if the host failed to move at all, or null if the destination was unreachable in the first place

      • clearRadius

      • beginSearch

        protected void beginSearch(DefaultMovement.PathData starting,
               int totalMove)
        Finds successive tiles for the host's starting location. By default, sets the movement mode's total move, and calls addProgressTiles(PathData) to add tiles.
        Parameters:
        starting - path data for the host's main tile before moving
        totalMove - the host's total movement

      • addProgressTiles

        protected void addProgressTiles(DefaultMovement.PathData fromData)
        Finds successive movement steps for a position during movement radius generation. These are tiles with facing directions where the mobile object could move from the given tile. New path data is added to a list to be handled as the movement radius generation continues. Tests for entering a tile are performed first. Tiles where the mobile object can't move or otherwise shouldn't be included in the search are not saved.

        The search gets the tile's neighbors, and calculates movement costs to them. It doesn't continue to tiles where a path with equal or lower cost already exists. Also, events and blocks must allow moving, and total move can't be exceeded.

        The possible neighbors for an asymmetric template are limited to one side, and there's an extra tile where the mobile object's main tile would be after turning in place. Cost to this tile is zero, and there's no need to check events.

        Parameters:
        fromData - contains tile, facing, total cost, movement height etc.

      • determineSuccessors

        protected Tile[] determineSuccessors(DefaultMovement.PathData pathData)
        Determines the default successor tiles for a tile. Usually, this means neighbors to all applicable directions around the tile, but asymmetric templates are handled differently. For them, only the directions on one side are returned. Instead of the other directions, makes the host turn in place and adds the main tile after the turn to the search.

        Turning in place doesn't cost any movement, or change the tiles where the host is located. Therefore, the total cost and risk, movement height, and occupy data in the new main tile's path data are the same as in the old path data. Only the main tile and facing change.

        Parameters:
        pathData - path data for the host's position
        Returns:
        neighbors to check
        See Also:
        addTurnInPlaceTile(Direction, PathData)

      • addTurnInPlaceTile

        protected void addTurnInPlaceTile(Direction newFacing,
                      DefaultMovement.PathData pathData)
        Adds a tile for turning in place to the search and sets its occupy properties.
        Parameters:
        newFacing - the mobile object turns to this facing
        pathData - path data for the mobile object's position before turning

      • shouldKeepPath

        protected boolean shouldKeepPath(DefaultMovement.PathData newPath)
        Checks if a new path should be kept and added to the search. Keeps the new path if there's no path data to the given tile. Otherwise checks all existing path data using shouldKeepPath(PathData, PathData), unless the host's template is asymmetric and the old and new path data have different facing directions that would require the mobile object to turn in place. In that case, the old and new path data don't affect each other.
        Parameters:
        newPath - new path data with tile, facing etc.
        Returns:
        path should be added

      • shouldKeepPath

        protected boolean shouldKeepPath(DefaultMovement.PathData newPath,
                     DefaultMovement.PathData oldPath)
        Compares new path data to an old path data, and decides if the new path should be kept. If any existing paths have higher total cost and equal or higher risk, they are removed. If any existing path has both equal or lower total cost and equal or lower risk, then the new path isn't needed.
        Parameters:
        newPath - the new path
        oldPath - the old path
        Returns:
        new path should be kept

      • selectBestPath

        protected DefaultMovement.PathData selectBestPath(DefaultMovement.PathData[] pathData,
                                      Direction facing)
        Selects paths with the lowest risk, and then the one with the lowest cost from those.
        Parameters:
        pathData - select the best of these paths
        facing - template's facing in the tile
        Returns:
        the best path
